tool.name: AddDirectionedRouteIdField

param.name: in_table
param.dialogReference: The input table that will have a new field added.
param.pythonReference: The input table that will have a new field added.

param.name: route_id_field
param.dialogReference: The field containing WSDOT route ID data.
param.pythonReference: The field containing WSDOT route ID data.

param.name: out_route_id_field_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the new route ID + direction field.
param.pythonReference: The name of the new route ID + direction field.

param.name: out_error_field_name
param.dialogReference: The name for the error field that will be added to the table. If any errors are encountered that prevent the output route ID from being generated, that error information will be written to this field.
param.pythonReference: The name for the error field that will be added to the table. If any errors are encountered that prevent the output route ID from being generated, that error information will be written to this field.

param.name: route_id_suffix_type
param.dialogReference:
Determines the format of the route ID that will be written to the new field.

Valid values are as follows:

  • D_ONLY

  • I_ONLY

  • ALL
param.pythonReference:
Determines the format of the route ID that will be written to the new field.

Valid values are as follows:

  • D_ONLY

  • I_ONLY

  • ALL

param.name: wsdot_validate
param.dialogReference: Set to true if you want to check all routes IDs to see if they are valid WSDOT route IDs, false to skip this check. Default is True.
param.pythonReference: Set to true if you want to check all routes IDs to see if they are valid WSDOT route IDs, false to skip this check. Default is True.

tool.summary: Given a table with a WSDOT route ID field and a direction field (containing "I", "D", or "B"), this tool will add a new field that combines the route ID and the direction, so it can be used as a route event layer with multi-directional WSDOT LRS layers.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Given a table with a WSDOT route ID field and a direction field (containing "I", "D", or "B"), this tool will add a new field that combines the route ID and the direction, so it can be used as a route event layer with multi-directional WSDOT LRS layers.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Written by Jeff Jacobson for WSDOT. Public Domain.
